content: In 1924 which 'Great Gatsby' author spent time living in France as part of the expatriate community known as the "Lost Generation"?

F. Scott Fitzgerald spent time living in France in the 1920s as part of the expatriate community known as the "Lost Generation." He is best known for his novel "The Great Gatsby," which was published in 1925. During his time in France, Fitzgerald associated with other American expatriates such as Ernest Hemingway, Gertrude Stein, and Ezra Pound, who were also part of this literary movement.
